title: Unable to add exceptions for cookies
content:

I tried multiple times to add other links, reinstalled Thunderbird, and cleared all Appdata data/profiles but sadly it still doesn't let me add any exceptions.

title: Gmail refuses to allow TB to log in with an account that is under parental monitoring.
content: Since when Google made OAuth mandatory, a new TB profile is unable to log in with a G-Mail account that is under parental monitoring (i.e. using Google Family Link). I have an old TB profile where such an access is possible because the TB account was created before new Google OAuth requirements. Yes, and that old profile uses OAuth as log in method. But it is no more possible within a new TB profile. Some times Google says that such a log in is forbidden. Some times it presents a blank, useless response page.
creator: rosivaldo.fa

title: Unified Junk Folder
content:
With the recent update Thunderbird 115.1.1 my Unified Junk Folder got messed up: Prior to the update the unified parent-junk-folder used to have a list of sub-junk-folders associated each with the respective E-Mail account configured in Thunderbird. Now, there is only an empty parent-junk-folder left and the different spam/junk folders show up as sub-folders in the different inboxes.

How can the mappings from online-folders to offline folders be modified? I would like to map the online-junk-folder to an offline-junk-folder as well as to a sub-folder in the unified-junk-folder.
creator: rubisco57

title: Thunderbird Options
content:
It appears that I can still use my POP3 account with Thunderbird. With Outlook, I can set up each computer to either download my emails to the local device or leave them on the ESP server. I have one device that downloads them and I let the other computers leave them on the server. Does Thunderbird offer that option.

Second question: Outlook stores emails, calendar, and contacts in a consolidated .pst file (which I keep in a directory that is frequently backed up). How does Thunderbird store this info. What will happen to my .pst file(s) if I switch to Thunderbird?

Thanks in advance for your help on this.
creator: dnjvan

title: TB Calendar, Mac: any way to "cache" events and tasks?
content:
Hi,

Posted this a while ago at http://forums.mozillazine.org, but no response at all. Trying here.

Using TB 115.0.1 (64-bit) on a Mac with High Sierra (MacOS 10.13.6).

Googles security requirements no longer accept e.g. sync with default calendar in my version of the OS. So I use TB:s calendar.

However, one thing bugs me a lot and I have tried all settings to remedy this.

Each time I launch TB, the calendar is completely blank and it starta downloading from Google. I have several different calendars in my Google account, each with quite a few events. It takes several minutes to complete the download and obviously, I need to be online to be able to see coming events.

My question:

Is there any way to make TB cache all events and simply check with Google calendar and update when needed? Exactly as with my emails. Or is it just me who haven't figured it out?

Cheers! Dan
creator: dan279

title: Upgrade to Thunderbird 115 - folder display problem
content: I have several email accounts in Thunderbird. All displayed ok in Thunderbird 102, but after upgrading to 115 one account (IMAP) only displays Inbox Drafts and Sent. Can anyone suggest a fix please?
creator: robin.orme

title: Mail from specific forwarded domain not arriving in Thunderbird
content:
I have 2 business-related domains for which I have set-up identical forward rules at my provider. They both forward to the same private email address. I retrieve all my mail in Thunderbird for this private address/domain, so in that way I can handle mail for my private email domain as well as the 2 business-related domains using one mailbox in Thunderbird. This has worked wonderful for years.

Problem is, since a few weeks, only the mails for 1 of the 2 business domains is arriving at Thunderbird correctly. I have already checked with my provider, and they have confirmed that the 2 forwards for those domains are identical, and should work as I expect them. When I look in the webmail for both domains, I can see test messages arriving there. So the webmail works, even for the problematic domain. I have not changed anything related to the mail settings in Thunderbird since more than a year. I am using the most up to date version of Thunderbird (on Windows 11).

I checked for Thunderbird logs, and the only log I could find is a debug.log, and that is empty. I also disabled all Thunderbird filter rules, just to be sure that they weren't the culprit, but still the messages do not arrive. I also checked the junk folder of Thunderbird, and they are not there.

How can I find out why none of the mails for 1 business domain are not arriving in Thunderbird?
creator: bjorn25

title: mail list size and spam
content:
I have a series of questions regarding Thunderbird 102.14.0 For several years I have been unable to send to a mailing list of aprox 50 people and was told it was too many people. I overcame this problem by sending the email to 10 ten different people 5 times. This has worked since then but recently some of those emails have been going straight to the recipient's spam

I want to be able to send one email to every one of my mailing list and also want to prevent it from being recognized as spam
creator: barryd1

title: Cannot open or save large PDF attachment in incoming email
content: I received an email with a large (> 20MB) PDF attachment. I'm using an IMAP server with no local copies of email on the client that's running Thunderbird. The email's body opened OK. I tried to open the PDF attachment and just saw a few garbage characters. I tried to save the PDF attachment to local disk and resulting PDF file is binary containing exactly 27 bytes! Same problem occurs on Linux and Windows( 10 and 11) installs of Thunderbird 102.14.0 (64 bit). The incoming email itself is NOT corrupted: I was able to use Thunderbird to save the whole email to local disk as a .eml file and then open that saved copy in Thunderbird and access the PDF attachment. The problem is not with the IMAP server: I copied the email to a postfix server, to gmail, to yahoo.com and to a Microsoft server, all with the same issue. This problem happens only when the incoming email has very large attachments - smaller attachments of the same type can be saved or opened with no problem.
creator: subelman
